message.content:
cs.CR, cs.OS, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.DS 

The paper discusses a security challenge related to timing channels in cloud environments and proposes a hypervisor-enforced timing mitigation approach. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-category. Additionally, the paper focuses on the implementation of the proposed approach on existing operating systems such as Linux, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.OS (Operating Systems) sub-category. The paper also discusses resource sharing and performance costs, which suggests that it may belong to the cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) sub-category. The proposed approach involves enforcing a deterministic view of time on guest code, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.SE (Software Engineering) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of timing mitigators to pace I/O and rate-limit potential information leakage, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category.
